elements.text: No sign of them anywhere.
(a woman) This is it, though. Zone delta delta.
[OC]: The enemy agents are a human male, four oh plus, and a human female, two oh plus, called the Doctor and Mel.
It’s no good. We could search these ruins for days and not find them.
Hang on. What's that?
The Tardis materialises.
Some sort of blue box appearing out of thin air.
Something to do with the escaped agents?
Can't be a coincidence. Let’s get under cover.
Weird sounds from the time rotor.
Doctor, what’s happen (silence) happening?
Just some turbulence in the Vortex, Mel.
I thought the ship was going to shake itself to pieces, and us with it.
I grant you the landing may have been a little on the bumpy side.
Bumpy? I’m not inclined to use rude words, Doctor, but if I was I’d use several to describe how bumpy that landing was.
We’ve arrived slap-bang er, on target. The Earth colony on the planet Puxatornee in the year 3090, December the 24".
So what are we doing here? And why did we leave the space yacht Pinto in such a hurry?
It’s perfectly simple, Mel. This is the only planet in the galaxy where you can find leptonite crystals.
Leptonite?
If a Quark goes within half a mile of leptonite, it goes berserk and explodes.
Oh, I see. So we get the crystals, pop back to the Pinto, and quash the Quarks.
Hopefully it won’t come to that, but yes.
You're sure this is the right place? It’s all rubble and ruins.
It’s very strange. The last time I was here, it was a model of prosperity.
And that was?
The year Paktafroon Wabstar had their first number one. 3012.
Seventy eight years ago. Things are bound to have changed since then.
Not for the better, it seems.
Mmm, it does look dreadfully grim. The sort of place that would have Edgar Allan Poe reaching for his notebook. What's that noise?
Lots of beeping and is that a faint Cloister bell?
The level of background radiation is a shade higher than I would like. What has happened here?
You want to explore, don’t you?

Well, according to the instruments, there’s a leptonite source not far away. We can investigate, I mean, simultaneously. We'd better wrap up, though. It’s snowing heavily out there. Here, put these on.
What are they?
They protect the wearer against radiation. Come on.
It’s them, Stewart. It’s them. The Doctor and Mel.
They’re standing around where anyone could see them.
Like they wanted to get caught.
Yes. Maybe they’re not saboteurs after all. Think, Lieutenant. We haven’t heard from the Slithergees for over two decades. No, Reed, they’re here for something else. Power up the vape guns.
Boots on snow.
Listen up.
A clock chimes.
Twelve o’clock. Which means it’s
Merry Christmas, Mel.
And to you, Doctor. Though I can’t imagine anyone spending a merry Christmas here.
Greetings, citizens of Puxatornee. This is your President speaking. I would like to wish everyone a sombre retribution day, as we remember our former leader President Bailey.
Retribution day?
Shh.
Following the recent disturbance in zone epsilon alpha, all citizens are to remain within their homes. Anyone found outdoors will be reprimanded. Fatally.
Sombre music.
Reprimanded fatally? Doctor, shouldn’t we go back to
Stay still! One move and you'll be vaporised.
You’re coming back to Central Bureau with us, for interrogation.
But we haven’t done anything.
This zone is off-limits, and you’re self-confessed spies.
Spies? We’re not spies. And even if we were, we’d hardly be self-confessed ones.
You’re changing your story. I see. So if you’re not spies, what are you, Doctor, Mel?
You know our names?
You gave them when you were first brought in.
We did? That was very cooperative of us.
You talked about the Professor’s machine.
What machine? And what Professor, for that matter?
Don’t play games. You confessed to everything.
You wouldn’t care to remind us what we confessed to, would you?
You claimed to be working for the Slithergees.
Slithergees? What are Slithergees?
Hal! You really are insane, aren’t you.
I’m afraid you have us at a disadvantage. Could you remind us of your names, Mister er?
Lieutenant Stewart. And this is Lieutenant Reed.
Of course. Now perhaps you could accompany us to Central Bureau.
Doctor!
There’s a lot of explaining to do, and I prefer to do it in a nice, warm atmosphere.
Get into the snow buggy. Slowly.
Whispering.
Doctor, how do they know who we are? And why do they think we’re spies?
I’m not sure. We haven’t been here before.
Doctor, maybe we come here at some point in our future, and we’re experiencing the repercussions of things we haven't done yet.
It’s a possibility, yes. One of the hazards of time travel is that occasionally you trip over your own footprints. But I have a worrying feeling it may turn out to be even more complicated than that.
Well, whatever’s going on, they seem to think we’re up to mischief. The moment we stepped out of the Tardis they were pointing guns at us.
(laughs) Yes. So no change there, then.
Door opens and closes.
Salute.
And a merry (ahem) and a grievous retribution day to you.
To you too, Professor Capra. Your machine is ready?
Oh yes, your Presidency. The experiment will commence in one hours time. The culmination of fifteen years work.
You still need the assistance of the lieutenants?
Oh yes, yes, yes. President Mitchell, I was wondering. I've been cooped up like a snow pug in my laboratory for months. Could I possibly see my family one last time before
That’s not possible. They were rationalised.
What!
You know how limited supplies are. There was only enough food for one, and as your work was of such importance, you were given priority. You have been living on your family’s allocation, Professor.
No. No, I won’t help you. I can’t! You’re

Evil? No. I make tough decisions and I live with the consequences. My conscience never rests. We must all of us make sacrifices, Professor, and I have merely made one on your behalf. Return to work. Or would you prefer your family to have died in vain?
Er, yes. Yes, yes, you’re right. The experiment must succeed, for all our sakes.
Comms beep.
Mitchell.
[OC]: Salute. President, the Doctor and Mel have been recaptured. Lieutenant Reed and I will resume the interrogation.
In quad again. Sometimes I think I’ve seen the inside of more prison cells than I’ve had green salads.
Now, let’s see. Ah. Cypher lock. Well, it should only take a couple of oh, that was quick. Sometimes I amaze myself. Oh. Lieutenant Stewart.
You’re not getting out that easily again, Doctor.
This door can now only be unlocked from the outside.
Well, if you’re intending to hold us captive, that would seem a sensible idea.
We want to know what you’re doing here on Puxatornee.
And why you claim to be Slithergee spies.
We're not claiming to be spies. After all, if we were spies, we’d hardly make a song and dance about it, would we?
That’s what makes it so suspicious.
I have an idea. If you tell us about these Slithergees, I promise we'll tell you what we’re up to.
That doesn’t make sense. You must know about the Slithergees.
Telling us can’t do any harm, can it?
About thirty years ago their spaceship appeared in orbit. Their home planet had been destroyed. They were refugees.
Refugees who travelled in a heavily armed battlecruiser.
They delivered an ultimatum to our President, Bailey. She could either give them one of our moons or risk starting a war.
And so she decided to start a war?
No. Before she had a chance to negotiate she was murdered by one of their agents.
And you retaliated.
We had no choice.
Just like that? Did no one speak out against it?
My father did. He was executed for saying that Puxatornee would have been a nicer place to live if we’d given the Slithergees what they wanted.
But you won in the end, I take it?
At great cost. The Slithergees left our planet a poisonous wasteland. Nothing can survive out there.
But how can you live if there’s no
We can't. Those of us who are left breathing won't be for much longer. Which is why Professor Capra’s machine is the only solution.
The one we, the one we already know about.
Yes. Using the Professor’s time machine we will travel back and
Ah, hold your horses there. Did you say time machine?
Yes. We will travel back to the point where the Slithergees first arrived and prevent the war from happening.
Oh, I see. By destroying them before they have a chance to attack.
No. By making peace with them.
Walking on snow.
Officer Potter, you were on duty the night that President Bailey was killed.
That’s correct, President Mitchell.
Cast your thoughts back to that night. Christmas Eve 3060.
I remember, I remember you leaving Central Bureau just before midnight.
I’d been working late with President Bailey. We were, she was considering her response to the Slithergees. What happened then, Potter?
There was a security alert. We received a warning that the President would be assassinated, but when we got to her office, she was already dead.
And her secretary.
Clarence? He’d shot her, then
Then turned the gun on himself. How were they when you discovered them?
We've been through this a thousand times, President.
How were they?
They were disrobed, as though they had been engaged in an activity of a sexual nature.
Bailey would never. She wouldn't do that. She. (door slides open) Had you ever had any suspicion that Clarence was a Slithergee agent?
No.
Could he have any other reason to kill her?
Door slides shut.
No, no. But he was a Slithergee agent. The evidence

Of course. We later produced evidence linking him to the enemy. If Bailey hadn’t died, she would have secured a peaceful settlement, I’m sure of it. A future was denied to us that night. Puxatornee lost its finest leader, and I lost, I lost
Ahem. President, I am due back on patrol.
Of course. But first, check on the Doctor and Mel. I want to know more about them.
Salute.
Yes. Salute.

So let me get this straight. You’re going to go back in time to kill the President’s secretary, Clarence, before he can kill the President, so the President, who won't be dead, can then forge a peace treaty?
But you knew all this already.
Of course. But you tell it so well.
Now, Doctor, it’s your turn to answer our questions.
Alarm sounds.
Stewart, we’re due on patrol. We'll have to conclude the interrogation later.
Oh, and I was just beginning to enjoy it.
Don't worry, we'll be back sooner than you think.
Door opens and closes.
So, Doctor, what now?
We're locked in. It seems we have no choice but to sit and contemplate our fate.
Do you think they can do it? Travel through time.
Given sufficient resources and desperation, I don’t see why not. It’s not against the laws of physics. But I can’t permit it. Changing history isn’t like changing a light bulb.
Why? What could happen?
Well, you might burn your hand or get electrocuted or fall off a step-ladder.
No, not changing a light bulb, Doctor. Changing history.
Oh, changing history. Well, all sorts of confusing things can happen. For example, if
Door opens.
2: Doctor! Mel! We've found you.
Back so soon? Did you forget something?
2: What are you talking about.
Well, you only left a moment ago.
No, Mel. This isn’t the Stewart and Reed who just left. This appears to be another Stewart and Reed. How odd.
2: Mel, it’s us. You can’t have forgotten.
Well, look, whoever you are, what do you want with us?
2: We’ve come to rescue you. Again. We just pretended to be the Lieutenants to get into the building.
The guards agreed to hand you over.
How kind.
2: We still need your help, Doctor. Once we get back to the Tardis, you’re going to
What? You know about the Tardis?
2: There’s no time to talk. We've got to get out of here before they become suspicious.
Mitchell.
[OC]: President Mitchell. The Doctor and Mel, they’ve just been handed over to Lieutenants Stewart and Reed. They're leaving the Bureau.
What! I gave no such instruction. (changes channel) Lieutenant Stewart, what do you think you’re doing?
[OC]: We’re just starting patrol.
You're not in Central Bureau?
[OC]: No, we’re on zone omega beta.
Get back here at once.
[OC]: Salute.
Officer Potter, whoever it is who is with the Doctor and Mel, it isn’t Stewart and Reed. They must not be allowed to escape. You are authorised to use any force necessary.
[OC]: Understood. Salute. (weapons fire, sirens) It’s too late. One of our guards managed to shoot the imposters, but the other two got away. They were last seen heading for lambda rho.
Then get after them!
That was close. They didn’t expect us to double back. Oh Doctor, those poor people who rescued us.
They were vaporised. A very efficient form of killing, if not particularly friendly towards the ozone layer.
But who were they? Stewart and Reed’s long-lost identical twins?
Later, Mel. Much later. While the guards are out searching the city, I want to see this time machine of theirs.
You want to sabotage it, you mean.
The Web of Time is very delicate, Mel. One wrong ingredient and the whole thing might collapse like an overheated soufflé. I can’t allow history to be altered.

[OC]: Attention all sec patrols. This is your President speaking. Two Slithergee agents have escaped from captivity and must be recaptured at once. The enemy agents are the ones identified previously as the Doctor and Mel.
Capra laboratory. Absolutely positively no admittance. Trespassers will be evaporated. Hmm, this sounds like it might be the place.
It’s unguarded. Strange.
Presumably the security people are out looking for us.
Presumably. Come on, we'll
Whispering now.
Someone’s coming.
Quick, Mel, behind here.
It’s them. It’s Stewart and Reed. But they were vaporised.
It’s the Lieutenants Stewart and Reed.
Oh, the originals. Doctor, they’re blocking the entrance.
Yes. You know, what we really need now is some sort of diversion. If only I
Do you think the President was right? The Doctor and Mel will try to break into the Professor’s lab.
Well, even if they’re not working for the Slithergees they're up to something, so
So maybe they are here to sabotage the experiment. After all, it is at a critical stage.
[OC]: Lieutenant Stewart?
Salute.
[OC]: A sec patrol has picked up Mel and the Doctor in zone lambda rho. I want you and Lieutenant Reed to bring them in.
Understood, President Mitchell. Salute.
Lambda rho? That’s on the other side of the city.
Then again, it could all just be one big coincidence. Let’s go.
They’re moving away, Mel. This is our chance. Follow me.
J God rest ye merry, gentlemen, let nothing you dismay. Remember Bailey our glorious President was killed upon this day.
Door opens.
Computers and flashing lights. Yes, this must be it.
Door closes.
And if I’m not mistaken, the box of tricks with the tinsel on it is a time machine.
And who might you be?
Didn’t you hear the warning about the enemy agents?
Why?
We’re them.
Get out of my laboratory this nanosecond.
And being enemy agents, we’re the sort of people you would expect to be armed and highly dangerous.
What?
[OC]: Professor Capra?
So you’d better do as we say, buster.
Speaking.
[OC]: The enemy agents will be attempting to enter your laboratory. Stewart and Reed are on their way. Until they arrive, keep your door locked. Don’t open it for anyone.
Well? Answer.
Understood. Don’t let the Doctor and Mel in.
[OC]: Remember, Capra, the future of Puxatornee depends on you.
Right. Now, back against that wall, or I will be forced to show you exactly how armed and dangerous we are.
You allowed Mel and the Doctor to escape, Officer Potter. You will be executed for treason.
No, please, listen.
You still claim you handed them over to Stewart and Reed?
I’m not claiming anything. It was them. I’ve worked under the Lieutenants for the lasts five years.
But there’s no way they could have got from the laboratory to lambda rho that quickly!
Yes, but you only have their word for it, that they'd been guarding the lab in the first place, haven’t you.
You mean that when I called them, they were already on their way? That they had arranged to meet the spies? That they are collaborating with them?
I’m not saying anything. But when I offered to help escort the prisoners, they refused. I thought it was odd
But, yes, it makes sense. Stewart and Reed are in league with the Doctor and Mel, and I ordered them to go back to the Professor’s laboratory. The experiment! Hand me your gun.
You will not be needing my assistance?
No. I no longer need tolerate your ineptitude.
Vaporised with a scream.
And a sombre retribution day to you. Salute.
Keyboard sounds.
Why won't you leave my time machine alone? Oh dear.
Whatever it is you’re doing, Doctor, you’d better hurry up before Stewart and Reed come back.
Look, Mel. Leptonite crystals. Ah ha!
Door opens.
Step away from the machine, Doctor.
Oh, I really must stop speaking too soon.
Odd. There doesn’t seem to be an off switch. What an oversight.
Door closes.
Lieutenant Stewart said move away from the machine, Doctor.
Or I'll kill Mel.
You’re making a grave mistake.
You’re the one who’s making a grave mistake, Doctor. Kill them, Lieutenants. Vaporise them now.
No. No. Not until we know why they want to stop the experiment.
Because it’s my duty to protect Time. It’s line one of the Time Lord job description. You can’t, mustn't, meddle with history.
Oh, the machine is still functioning perfectly. Good, good. Lieutenants, if you will kindly take your places on the podium there, I will
Door opens.
Wait! Stop the experiment!
Door closes.
I’m afraid it’s too late, President.
You must not send the Lieutenants back in time..
Thank goodness someone has seen sense.
They are enemy agents working with the Doctor and Mel on behalf of the Slithergees.
On second thoughts.
What are you on about?
Get off the platform, both of you. You knew, didn’t you. The Slithergees must have told you
I can’t delay the temporal remission. Oh dear. (counts down quietly in the background)
Told us? Told us what?
President Bailey’s secretary wasn’t a Slithergee agent.
What?
Doctor, what are they talking about?
Shh. It'll probably all make sense later.
We don’t know why Clarence killed her, but he wasn’t acting for the Slithergees. Now, get off the podium, Lieutenants. I’m taking your place.
No. No! You mean the war was all a mistake? All because of you?
You don’t understand. I loved her! She betrayed me. I had to do something. I wasn’t thinking. I was wrong!
I’m going to kill you, President, for your crimes against Puxatornee.
Stewart, it doesn’t matter what he did. Think. If we go back in time and save Bailey's life, we can still prevent the war.
No, listen to the Doctor.
Mel, keep back. That time field is highly unstable.
Two.
Doctor!
Mel, watch out! Mel!
One.
Screams.
It worked.
They’ve vanished. Lieutenant Stewart and Mel.
There’s no time to lose. Reed, follow me.
What?
Do you want to see your friend again or not? No, no, wait.
What is it?
The leptonite crystals. Mustn’t forget them. Here, look after them for me. Now, come on, to the snow buggy.
Doctor, what happened back there?
The time field was misaligned, so the Professor’s machine sent Mel back through Time instead of you.
So, so she’s now in the past with Stewart.
Yes. But unfortunately, they were on a one-way ticket.
What?
The time machine was designed only to be used once, which means we can’t use it to go after them and we can’t use it to bring them back, so
So?
So we'll have to follow them in this, my time machine.
Tardis door opens.
Doesn't look much like a time machine to me.
Appearances are deceptive. Get in.
I don’t believe it. It’s bigger on the inside.
Tardis door closes. The Tardis dematerialises.
What do you mean, there’s nothing you can do?
The machine, it’s no good. Every circuit has overloaded. I was never any good at wires.
Then we can only that Lieutenant Stewart succeeds and saves President Bailey, so she never died, so that none of this ever happened.
Indeed. So that we are not now standing here about to die in a massive explosion.
Yes. What?
I never did resolve the power supply difficulties. The machine can’t be turned off.
You mean it’s going to destroy the laboratory?
Think bigger.
The whole building?
Bigger than that.
The city?
You're getting warmer. In fact, we both are.
How long do we left
KaBOOM!
The Central Bureau building, Christmas Eve, the year 3060, just after eleven p.m.
We’ve arrived at the same time as the others?
Not quite. They’ve a head-start. We have to reach them before, before Stewart murders the President’s secretary.
But he has to do it. If it saves our planet, it’s worth
If? If? You can’t predict the consequences. You might alter events for the worse.
How could things be worse?

Reed, I brought you here because I need your help. Now, this is your chance to save your world. To save it from Stewart’s interference. I want you to tell me everything you know about the night the President died.
There was some sort of security alert just before she was killed. We planned to use it as a diversion so that the coast would be clear when we
The Slithergee delegates are humbly demanding an answer. Will you allow them to occupy the first moon?
Oh, what do you think, Deputy Mitchell?
If you refuse, President Bailey, then it could mean war. If you don’t, then you risk them gaining a foothold. Either way, the consequences could be disastrous for Puxatornee.
I know. (yawns) Oh, I’m sorry. You go to bed. I'll have the answer in the morning.
Shall I wait up?
No. I'll be here a few hours at least.
Aren’t you forgetting something, President?
Oh, happy Christmas, darling. (kiss) I'll try not to wake you. I love you.
And I love you.
Footsteps, door opens and closes. Picks up telephone and presses buttons.
Clarence? Yes, he’s just left. You can come in now.
Phone down. Door opens and closes.
My President. At your service.
Passionate embrace and kisses.
Why was Deputy Mitchell here so late?
Never mind him. It’s you I want. I want you to give me my Christmas present.
The President’s office must be around here somewhere. Why do corridors always look the same wherever I go? I can’t help feeling I’ve been this way before.
It must be this way, I think. Stewart must have got there by now.
No. You said there was a security alert before the President was killed.
Yes, but we don’t know
Ah. Now there hasn’t been an alert yet, has there? Which gives me an idea.
Smash! Alarm sounds.
(using tannoy) Attention all units! Stop whatever it is you’re doing. This is a priority one code red emergency. There is going to be an assassination attempt on the President.
There. One security alert.
You caused the alert?
It should bring every guard running. Now, even if we don’t stop Stewart.
Talking of which. Doctor, there they are.
Running.
In the throes of passion.
I’ve loved you, I’ve always loved your body. Let me unwrap it.
It is my duty to serve my President in any way I can.
Door opens, weapons fire.
No!
No! Clarence!
You killed him. You shot him in cold blood!
President Bailey.
Distant clock chimes midnight.
What do you want? Who are you?
I have just saved your life. You were about to be assassinated.
Assassinated? By who?
Your secretary. He was going to kill you.
Clarence? No, but that doesn’t any sense.
Stop!
It’s too late, Doctor. Stewart’s already killed him. He saved the President’s life.
No. Hand me the gun, Reed. There is still one way I can make sure history remains on track. I shoot the President myself.
What? No, please, I beg you.
If you pull that trigger, I'll kill you, Doctor.
I can’t allow the past to be altered.
Doctor!
I can’t. I can’t do it. I won’t do it.
Then history will have to change.
[Part Two — White Disc]
You haven't the foggiest idea what you’ve done, have you?
Oh no, Doctor, I do. I’ve just saved the world.
What do you mean?
President Bailey, we’re from a future where you were assassinated, where war was declared on the Silthergees.
You musin’t let that happen. You must make peace with them, whatever the cost.
But, my secretary, Clarence.
Don’t worry, you shot him in self-defence.
But why was he going to kill me? We were a
Listen to me. Give the Slithergees what they want. The alternative is to deny us a future. Do you understand?
I understand.
Sorry to interrupt, but there is the small matter of the security alert. In a few minutes this place will be swarming with guards.
We know what we have to do. We vaporise ourselves to remove any evidence.
No, Stewart, wait. The Doctor has a time machine. We can return to the future.
Well, Lieutenant? Or would you prefer to stay here and let off steam?
But Doctor, you can’t want to help them after what he did?
There’s no time to discuss it now. We must return to the Tardis. When I say run, run. Come on!
Alarms.
[OC]: Deputy Mitchell, this is Officer Potter. We’ve located President Bailey in her office. There was some sort of assassination attempt.
What?
[OC]: Don’t worry, she’s unharmed. She managed to kill her secretary before he could shoot her.
Clarence? What was he doing there? Officer Potter, get me the President.
[OC]: Deputy Mitchell.
Thank the saints. When I heard the security alert, I thought, what if I had lost you?
[OC]: Inform the Slithergees that we will accede to their demands. They can occupy the first moon. Now leave me alone.
But I
[OC]: Whatever you have to say, I’m not interested.
Doctor.
Tardis door closes.
You didn’t say run.
What?
You said, when I say run, run, but then you said come on. I mean, I am loathe to quibble but
Hold on.
The Tardis dematerialises.
We did it, Reed. We did it.
You certainly did.
So now we’re going to a different future, where President Bailey wasn't killed?
Indeed. History has been diverted onto a new path.
And the old history, where she did die?
The only evidence that it ever existed is here with us in this room, isn’t it, Lieutenant Stewart.
You’ve seen what the war did to Puxatornee, Doctor. I had to do it.
You murdered Bailey’s secretary.
He was going to kill her, Mel.
Was he?
It’s a matter of historical record. And what does one person matter compared to a whole world? The ends justify the means.
Lieutenant, there have been many unspeakable evils committed in the name of the ends justifying the means.
Bing!
We’ve landed.
Christmas Day in the year 3090.
We've arrived at the same time as we left?
Give or take an hour or so. And a couple of miles. Time travel isn’t an exact science. It’s more a vague one.
Particularly when the Doctor’s at the controls.
Oi.
I know where we are. This is zone lambda rho, on the other side of the city. But it was never like this.
No background radiation, and it’s still snowing. A veritable winter wonderland.
Hmm. But I don’t think giant concrete honeycombs were quite what Doris Day had in mind.
Tardis doors open.
There you go, Lieutenants. Your future awaits.
I never thought I'd live to see this day.
Oh, just imagine it. Anew Puxatornee, free from fear. A new life.
Stewart and Reed leave.
Well, I’m glad that’s all done and dusted. Now, what about those leptonite crystals?
I managed to retrieve some from the Professor’s machine, Mel.
Marvellous! So let’s get back to the space yacht Pinto and deal with those Quarks.
Or we could take a quick look around, Mel. I mean, it is a fascinating opportunity to see the
difference that one person can make. No, you're right. We should leave. Now where did I put the crystals?
Oh, you haven’t lost them.
No. I gave them to Lieutenant Reed for safe keeping. Ah. Problem.
2 [OC]: This is Slithergee patrol 14. I have followed the dissidents’ trail to the derelict toy shop in ghetto epsilon alpha.
Make sure no one gets out alive. (ends comms) Sorry for that, Community Leader. How may I help you?
I have a most humble and mild request. We Slithergees have noticed that the human Representative Committee is unrepresentative.
In what way?
There are no Slithergees on it.
But that’s because it’s to represent humans. There are no humans on your committee, after all.
That is because a human cannot comprehend the Slithergee ethnic experience. We are being discriminated against. Please see that our quota is met.
What you’re asking is ridiculous.
I had hoped you would be more sympathetic than your late predecessor, President Mitchell. We are poor, lowly Slithergee.
I’m willing to negotiate, but
You consider our requests to be ridiculous. Some would consider that a nastiness hate crime. If you will excuse me, I must confer with the Slithergee Representative Committee.
As you wish. Allow me to guide you to the door.
Door opens and closes.
Bailey, why did you have to do it? Why did I have to lose you? Such a waste.
You seem worried, Mel.
